member.name: T:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand
member.summary: Implements the Write-Message command, performing message handling and loggin

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Level
member.summary:
This parameter represents the verbosity of the message. The lower the number, the more important it is for a human user to read the message. By default, the levels are distributed like this: - 1-3 Direct verbose output to the user (using Write-Host) - 4-6 Output only visible when requesting extra verbosity (using Write-Verbose) - 1-9 Debugging information, written using Write-Debug
In addition, it is possible to select the level "Warning" which moves the message out of the configurable range: The user will always be shown this message, unless he silences the entire verbosity.
Possible levels: Critical (1), Important / Output / Host (2), Significant (3), VeryVerbose (4), Verbose (5), SomewhatVerbose (6), System (7), Debug (8), InternalComment (9), Warning (666) Either one of the strings or its respective number will do as input.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Message
member.summary: The message to write/log. The function name and timestamp will automatically be prepended.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Tag
member.summary: Tags to add to the message written. This allows filtering and grouping by category of message, targeting specific messages.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.FunctionName
member.summary: The name of the calling function. Will be automatically set, but can be overridden when necessary.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module, the calling function is part of. Will be automatically set, but can be overridden when necessary.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.File
member.summary: The file in which Write-Message was called. Will be automatically set, but can be overridden when necessary.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Line
member.summary: The line on which Write-Message was called. Will be automatically set, but can be overridden when necessary.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.ErrorRecord
member.summary: If an error record should be noted with the message, add the full record here. Especially designed for use with Warning-mode, it can legally be used in either mode. The error will be added to the $Error variable and enqued in the logging/debugging system.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Exception
member.summary: Allows specifying an inner exception as input object. This will be passed on to the logging and used for messages. When specifying both ErrorRecord AND Exception, Exception wins, but ErrorRecord is still used for record metadata.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Once
member.summary: Setting this parameter will cause this function to write the message only once per session. The string passed here and the calling function's name are used to create a unique ID, which is then used to register the action in the configuration system. Thus will the lockout only be written if called once and not burden the system unduly. This lockout will be written as a hidden value, to see it use Get-DbaConfig -Force.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.OverrideExceptionMessage
member.summary: Disables automatic appending of exception messages. Use in cases where you already have a speaking message interpretation and do not need the original message.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Target
member.summary: Add the object the message is all about, in order to simplify debugging / troubleshooting. For example, when calling this from a function targeting a remote computer, the computername could be specified here, allowing all messages to easily be correlated to the object processed.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.EnableException
member.summary: This parameters disables user-friendly warnings and enables the throwing of exceptions. This is less user friendly, but allows catching exceptions in calling scripts.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Commands.WriteMessageCommand.Breakpoint
member.summary: Enables breakpoints on the current message. By default, setting '-Debug' will NOT cause an interrupt on the current position.

member.summary: When encountering issues, terminate, or skip the currently processed input, rather than continue.

member.summary: Continue, but provide output that can be used to identify the operations that had issues.

member.summary: The attribute used to define the elements of a ParameterClass contract

member.name: P:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.Type
member.summary: Returns the type of the element this attribute is supposed to be attached to.

member.name: P:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.Behavior
member.summary: Returns the behavior to expect from the contracted element. This sets the expectations on how this element is likely to act.

member.name: M:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.#ctor(Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractType,Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior)
member.summary: Ceates a perfectly common parameter contract attribute. For use with all parameter classes' public elements.

member.name: T:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior
member.summary: Defines how this element will behave

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.NotContracted
member.summary: This elements is not actually part of the contract. Generally you wouldn't want to add the attribute at all in that case. However, in some places it helps avoiding confusion.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Mandatory
member.summary: This element may never be null and must be considered in all assignments. Even if the element is de facto not nullable, all constructors must assign it.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Optional
member.summary: This element may contain data, but is not required to. In case of a method, it may simply do nothing

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Failable
member.summary: This method may throw an error when executing and should always be handled with try/catch. Use this on methods that use external calls.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Arbiter
member.summary: The content of the thus marked field determines the dependent's state. Generally, only if the arbiter is true, will the dependent elements be mandatory. This behavior may only be assigned to boolean fields.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Conditional
member.summary: This behavior can be assigned together with the 'Mandatory' behavior. It means the field is only mandatory if an arbiter field is present and set to true.

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Conversion
member.summary: Converts content. Generally applied only to operators, but some methods may also convert information.

member.name: T:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractType
member.summary: Defines what kind of element is granted the contract

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Field
member.summary: The contracted element is a field containing a value

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Method
member.summary: The contracted element is a method, performing an action

member.name: F:Sqlcollaborative.Dbatools.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Operator
member.summary: The contracted element is an operator, facilitating type conversion. Generally into a dedicated object type this parameterclass abstracts.
